properties.name: Centre Island Beach CIB
properties.description: Posted by Kiteboarding  bay or sound ridinghttp://newind.org/viewtopic.php?t=142Bayville: Great spot close to the City for NW winds as well as the occasional easterlies. Large beach allows for easy launching and access to the water. Very friendly spot although NW winds can be gusty at times and waters a bit choppy. Restricted access during summer. Directions: STEHLI BEACH - Bayville. 495E to x41N (rte 106 N) proceed to town center Oyster Bay left on W. Main at "T" left onto Bayville AVE Watch for "Ransom Beach" just past "Steve\'s Pier One" Next beach is Stehli (it\'s unmarked; road takes sharp turn away from water at entrance; see green sign for "ICN VILLAGE OF LATTINGTON")Sailing in Bayville is usually from the public beach (the west end is the only area from where it is allowed to launch -- but nobody checks in the fall). You can get to this site from the town of Oyster Bay through: East Main Street - West Shore Road - Bayville Ave (a total of about 5 miles). In the summer there\'s a 10$ parking lot fee. Parking at other b

properties.name: Ditch Plains
properties.description: Posted by Kiteboardinghttp://www.newind.org/viewtopic.php?t=214Ditch Plains: The most consistent longboard wave on the east coast north of Hatteras. Very popular with Long Island surfers. The bay at ditch is a great place to kite on a very strong Southwest windy day. When iwindsurf is show solid green and the surf reports show some waves this place goes off. Most windsurfers on Long Island keep to the flat waters like ponds so windsurfers are super rare. Big kites are perfect here. Keep your distance from surfers in the water. Not a beginner spot because if you go downwind more than a 1/4 mile its all rocks for a beach. Best Wind direction: Southwest - South. East and West winds are super rare. Dont even try on an North winds. Direction: Ditch Plains road is a right turn to make off of Montauk Hwy after passing thru the town of Montauk NY. Take road to end. Rules and regulations: Parking by east hampton permit during summer months Resources; www.tristatekites.com

Parking lot L will be on your right. Walk across the road. Cost: 0 to enter the park in the summer 0 season pass free off season Level: Intermediate Description: Small sandy beach in the Sandy Hook bay Wind directions: W Dangers: - If you cant stay upwind, you\'ll end up in the rocks

properties.name: Napeague kiting/ parking
properties.description: Posted by Kiteboardinghttp://newind.org/viewtopic.php?t=140Napeague Bay is a small bay and gets great wind thus it works well for all skill levels. Because the bay is shallow and mostly enclosed it is especially good for teaching and for beginners who are honing their high wind skills. (To this end we hear that someone offers instruction and rentals throughout the summer. Unfortunately have no more information than this at the current time.)The Napeague launch is at the end of a dirt road. Parking permit sticker required year-round for non-East Hampton residents. You can purchase a nonresident sticker at the East Hampton Town Hall (631-324-4142) for 25. If you have a trailer or for a lower cost approach you can get a launch sticker and park at the launching ramps for 0 a season. The alternative to getting a sticker is a 25 parking ticket -- which we hear is a certainty since the town tickets aggressively. Some sailors suggest dropping off your gear then parking behind the signs and walking to the water.Exactly where y

properties.name: Smith point County park
properties.description: Posted by Kiteboarding Bay and oceanhttp://www.newind.org/viewtopic.php?t=215Smith Point Park: Another Southwest big beach spot. Parking for a 5-10 dollar fee. No rules yet. Just head downwind of the people on the beach. You have 5 miles of beach with no one on it for your kite fun. Barrier island beach setup. No rocks and lots of fun sandbars to form fun waves. Again iwindsurf shows green this place is fun. Be nice to all the spectators. Best Wind direction: Any south related wind. Direction: South End of the William Floyd Parkway. When it ends you are there. Rules and regulations: Yes just walk downwind of the crowds on the beach. This is a county beach not a town beach not a state park beach. Enjoy. Resources; www.tristatekites.com

properties.name: Stehli Beach

properties.name: The Hamptons
properties.description: Posted by Kiteboardinghttp://www.newind.org/viewtopic.php?t=216Hamptons Long Island: Wide sandy beaches cape hatteras style. Best on the normal south west winds during summer. When iwindsurf shows the green go! Plenty of space no rules. The only hard part is deciding how to park legally on the beach you decide on and getting the correct directions to your kiting friends. There are many spots with some sand bars close to shore with makes for some fun kickers to jump off. Good spots would be West Hampton Beach Ponoqugue South Hampton Town beaches and East Hampton also. All beaches have soft sand and few rocky areas. Waves always increase the fun factor. Best Wind direction: Any south related wind. East and West works also but is extremely rare. On Southwest wind you could do a downwinder for 30 miles easy depending on if you could find a sucker friend to drive. Direction: The entire east end of Long Island. Rules and regulations: Few rules so far regarding kiting. Only state park land has a outstanding ban on all kiting

properties.name: west meadow beach
properties.description: Posted by Kiteboarding  http://www.newind.org/viewtopic.php?t=143Sinai Harbor/West Medow Beach: Nice Beach on the north shore of LI facing Westward. NW winds are quite on shore so be careful on take off and landing of your kite. Watch out for the shallow sand bars at low tide. Directions: LIE 495 to Exit 62. Go North on Nicolls road (Rt 97). Follow the road for about 9.5 miles until you get to a T intersection with North Country Road. Take a left follow for the road for about 800 yeard until you get to the 1st traffic light turn right on Quaker Path stay on Quanker Path for about 1.2 miles and when road splits stay left on Mount Grey Road. Proceed another 2/3 of a mile and take a left on West Meadow Road follow the road until you see the entrance to the beach parking lot on your left. Resources; www.tristatekites.com
